Article Title: “Something in me begins to heal”: Gisele Bündchen finds peace in nature and family while Tom Brady watches from a distance
Article Text:

Balancing family life and healing after years in the spotlight

At 45, Gisele Bündchen is showing a new chapter of her life—one that swaps runway lights for the quiet beauty of family and nature. The Brazilian supermodel recently shared a heartfelt post on Instagram , offering fans an intimate glimpse of her seven-month-old baby boy, her life with partner Joaquim Valente, and the healing energy she draws from the natural world.Among the serene images Gisele Bündchen posted, was a touching photo of her newborn’s tiny hand resting against her arm, highlighting a small star tattoo. The photo quickly drew attention from fans who have been eager for rare updates about the child she shares with Joaquim Valente. While Bündchen has not publicly confirmed his name, reports suggest his middle name is River, with speculation that the first name carries a personal tie to her late mother Vania Nonnenmacher or her twin sister Patricia.The post wasn’t just about family—it carried a message of mindfulness and gratitude. “Sometimes all we need is to stop and look around us,” Gisele Bündchen wrote. “Beauty is everywhere! Nature has always been my medicine. The moment I notice the wind in the trees, the light on the water, the birds singing... something in me begins to heal and my heart is filled with gratitude. Enjoy the gift that is today!”Gisele Bündchen’s feed has shifted in recent months, offering more glimpses into her grounded lifestyle in Brazil.Fans saw snapshots of ocean waves, rain-speckled windows, and a rainbow stretching across the countryside. In addition, she shared lighter moments with Valente, including a game of pool and family outings like glass blowing with her sister and basketball games with her older son.Alongside her newborn, Bündchen continues to raise Benjamin (15) and Vivian (12), whom she shares with ex-husband Tom Brady, as well as Brady’s son Jack (17). By sharing her slower, family-focused life, the model shows that even global icons can find peace in simple joys.Also Read: “Ended whatever was left”: Taylor Swift holds Blake Lively responsible for legal chaos after Travis Kelce home arrest For Bündchen, this season isn’t about high-profile campaigns but about rediscovering balance—through her children, her partner, and her deep connection to nature.

Article Title: Boston Bruins’ Mark Kastelic charges at New York Ranger’s 6-foot-9 Matt Rempe refusing to flinch
Article Text:
Mark Kastelic of the Boston Bruins prepares for a faceoff against the Vegas Golden Knights (Image Source - Getty Images)

Why Mark Kastelic charged at Matt Rempe

What really happened in Boston Bruins vs New York Rangers game

During the preseason matchup between the Boston Bruins and the New York Rangers, a key confrontation unfolded between forward Mark Kastelic and Rangers forward Matt Rempe. This incident happened in the last preseason game ahead of the Bruins' regular season debut.At the conclusion of the first period in Boston's last preseason game against New York at TD Garden. This was the Bruins' final rehearsal before their season opener on Wednesday, October 8, 2025.Kastelic started the brawl after both players left the penalty box, charging at Rempe with only five seconds left in the period. This was triggered by their earlier argument and penalties, as they "got after it again" immediately upon release.Kastelic's move was a testament to his character as a gritty forward who stands his ground, even when he's at a disadvantage in height (6-foot-4 vs. 6-foot-9), weight (234 pounds vs. 261 pounds), and reach compared to Rempe.As a new member of the Bruins after a June 2024 trade from the Ottawa Senators that involved goaltender Linus Ullmark, Kastelic has made it clear that he takes pride in bottom-six roles that require toughness and penalty killing.Kastelic mentioned to the press at Warrior Ice Arena, "Who won the bout? Probably him," talking about a previous match with his current teammate Jeannot, showcasing his readiness to take on challenging rivals.This incident happened after a bunch of physical plays. Bruins forward Tanner Jeannot executed a clean hit on Rangers defenseman Braden Schneider. Then, Kastelic and Rempe got into a verbal spat, leading to coincidental two-minute penalties for unsportsmanlike conduct with 2:33 to go in the period.These penalties were described as "ticky-tacky off-setting penalties" The Bruins seemed to have their sights set on Rempe early on, with Jeannot slamming him into the boards and Kastelic pushing him around on the following shift.This physicality is in line with earlier preseason games between the teams. On September 22, 2024, during a preseason match, a brawl broke out involving Kastelic and other players such as Victor Mancini, Brennan Othmann, and Parker Wotherspoon near the Rangers' net. Kastelic was eager to play physically in that game, but he didn't end up fighting.In the scuffle, both players were busy blocking each other's arms, and neither of them landed any direct hits at the start. As they twirled down to the ice, Rempe landed a couple of grazing punches on the back of Kastelic's helmet. The fight was noted as "basically a draw" in an X post noting Rempe landed more punches. The Bruins had their first fight of the preseason here. Kastelic is known for his fighting history, which includes a bout with Connor Mackey.Mark Kastelic proved he's ready to rise to the challenge, holding his own even when facing a much larger rival.Also Read: Kirill Kaprizov’s net worth in 2025: How his record-breaking Minnesota Wild contract could skyrocket his fortune
Article Summary: Boston Bruins forward Mark Kastelic charged at New York Rangers forward Matt Rempe. The incident happened during the Bruins' last preseason game against the Rangers. The Bruins will play the Rangers in their regular season opener on October 8, 2025. The fight was noted as "basically a draw" in an X post.

Article Title: “I'm going to be alone raising these kids” - Gabrielle Union shared her biggest fear when Dwyane Wade was diagnosed with life threatening cancer
Article Text:
Dwyane Wade with Gabrielle Union (Image via Getty)

Gabrielle Union talks about her biggest fear when Dwyane Wade was diagnosed with kidney cancer

Dwyane Wade Reveals Cancer Diagnosis Led to Kidney Surgery | E! News

Gabrielle Union reveals how Dwyane Wade’s cancer diagnosis took a toll on their relationship

Gabrielle Union and Dwyane Wade open up about their surrogacy journey

Former NBA star Dwyane Wade and his wife Gabrielle Union have been married for over a decade. They celebrated their 11th wedding anniversary on August 30 and even shared a montage of videos on Instagram marking their special day. Despite showcasing the bright sunny side on social media, the Wade couple has been through one of the toughest times. Gabrielle Union revealed her biggest fear when the former NBA star was diagnosed with Cancer.During an interview with the reputed media outlet Marie Clare, Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union opened up about one of the most toughest time in their life. While talking about the Miami Heat alum’s cancer diagnosis, Gabrielle Union shared one of her biggest fears. She said,"It was hard to navigate publicly the things that were happening privately. Even though we all know plenty of survivors, immediately you go to death, immediately we all internalize his cancer. It's our cancer."According to Union, she was scared and even worried that she would have to raise the kids in Dwyane Wade’s absence. The Bring It On star further mentioned,"I'll speak for myself when I say that the decisions that he was making hurt me about his cancer. It felt like, 'Oh, you're trying to kill me.And I'm going to be alone raising these kids. It's a very selfish response that I had, and it caused all kinds of problems, but [so did] his need for secrecy about his cancer decisions. It just starts sowing the seeds of distrust."After coming across the life-threatening tumor in Wade’s kidney, Gabrielle Union felt as if the NBA icon was almost near to death. She explained,"It just felt like he was trying to leave us—not in a marital sense, but a life and death sense. By the time he got it removed, I felt like we were more on the same page."Dwyane Wade underwent a kidney removal surgery in December 2023. Reportedly, his 40% right kidney was removed due to the cancer diagnosis. During this particular period of time, Gabrielle Union-Wade and the Heat's alum went through a lot in terms of trauma and anxiety. After Wade's cancer diagnosis, the fear of never being able to see her husband again took a toll on Gabrielle Union's mental health. The Hollywood star started living with the thought that she would be left alone taking care of their kids.The abandonment trauma impacted her physical and emotional well being. However, after leaving behind the tumor with a successful surgery, the Wades' make the most of their time along with their daughter, Kaavia. Dwyane Wade and his wife, Gabrielle Union, have been through one of the darkest times of their lives while supporting one another like a rock.During an appearance on Today with Jenna & Friends, Gabrielle Union revealed how her husband Dwyane Wade’s cancer diagnosis took a toll on their relationship. According to the Hollywood star, within 9 years of their marriage, they almost hit rock bottom when the NBA star was diagnosed with kidney cancer. Gradually, her mental and emotional health started suffering. She revealed,“It was year nine of our marriage and ... year nine was very hard. When you mention year nine being hard, he hadn’t revealed his cancer diagnosis and his own cancer journey, so now we can put it in more context.”She further elaborated,"Obviously him getting that diagnosis was traumatic for him: Being faced with your own mortality in your early 40s, and you’re like, ‘Am I going to be here to see my family? Who am I without this big life, and without this healthy body? But you also don’t understand the journey and the toll that it takes on your marriage, on your family, on your kids.”After being married for 11 long years, Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union share a daughter named Kaavia via surrogacy. The Hollywood star has struggled with health issues which left her with no option but to go ahead with surrogacy. After embracing the bliss of motherhood, Gabrielle Union and Dwyane Wade’s world revolves around their little daughter. After going through a rough patch in their respective lives, both Dwyane Wade and his beloved actor wife believe in enjoying every moment and accept every day the way it comes.Also Read: “I see what yall saw"- Dwyane Wade reflects on the 'actual reason' behind his crazy fan following with a throwback clip

They celebrated their 11th wedding anniversary on August 30 and shared a montage of videos on Instagram marking their special day. The Hollywood star has struggled with health issues which left her with no option but to go ahead with surrogacy. After going through a rough patch in their respective lives, both Wade and Union’s world revolves around their little daughter.

Former New York Jets quarterback Mark Sanchez among two injured in early morning Indianapolis attack

Reports say Sanchez was stabbed and taken to the hospital. At first, his condition was labeled as critical, but later it was confirmed to be stable.Officers from the Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department were called to an alley disturbance outside a pub close to West Washington Street and North Senate Avenue at around 12:30 a.m. on Saturday.The report indicated that one person had been stabbed and another was hurt. Article Title: Giants star Malik Nabers slams broken justice system in emotional post after LSU teammate Kyren Lacy’s tragic death ahead of grand jury hearing

Inside the final months that turned from legal battle to tragedy for Kyren Lacy

New York Giants wide receiver Malik Nabers has spoken out in anguish after the tragic death of his former LSU teammate Kyren Lacy, accusing the justice system of destroying reputations before facts are known. The 22-year-old rookie shared a powerful message on Instagram following Lacy’s death on April 12, 2025 — a day before the former LSU receiver was due to appear before a grand jury in Louisiana. Lacy had been charged in connection with a December 2024 car crash that killed a 78-year-old man, but his attorney maintained that new evidence was proving his innocence in the weeks leading up to his death.Only got to see his teammate’s name trending for the wrong reasons, Nabers poured out his frustration at how the media moved on once facts began to shift in Lacy’s favor. Posting a picture of his late friend, he wrote: “Bashed my dawg name! Shi crazy. Da Wrld sick gang. Dey put you on every news channel and sport network when you ‘allegedly’ charged wit sum. But when da truth comes out mfs dnt say nun and go in silence.”In another story, his emotions spilled over again as he added, “All my dawgs fallin to the same ‘justice system’ FOH. Shi a joke! Free u.” His words reflected a deep mix of grief, anger, and loyalty — a plea for fairness in a system he believes failed his brother long before his death.According to the Louisiana State Police, Lacy was charged with negligent homicide and felony hit-and-run after allegedly causing a fatal crash while trying to pass slower vehicles on a rural highway. The victim, identified as Donald Hymel, 78, was pronounced dead at the scene.Lacy’s attorney Matt Ory later revealed new footage and vehicle data that, according to him, indicated Lacy’s car was not involved in the impact. Ory said his client was finally beginning to feel hopeful again before tragedy struck. Lacy died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound during a brief police pursuit in Houston after a relative reported a domestic disturbance. His death came one day before the grand jury hearing that could have cleared his name.For Nabers and the LSU football community, the story isn’t just about a case — it’s about how quickly judgment spreads and how silence follows when truth surfaces. Many of their former teammates have joined in remembering Lacy as a humble and kind-hearted competitor whose quiet determination inspired everyone around him.During Giants training camp, Nabers wore thigh pads with Lacy’s face printed on them — a subtle yet powerful tribute that fans praised as heartfelt. Shortly after his death, Nabers wrote, “Pain. Numb. Sad… Broken. He taught many players everything, but we removed him from the captaincy of the 2027 World Cup for one year.We could not give him one year."He further added, "The captain who won us two ICC trophies in eight months will now be replaced by Shubman Gill. NEW DELHI: Shubman Gill 's appointment as India's ODI captain was always a question of when, and not why. The discussions had begun months before the official squad announcement on Saturday (October 4) for the Australia limited overs series.The decision makers got the conviction after seeing the side put up a solid show under the youngster in the five-Test series in England earlier in the year. It wasn't the mountain of runs he scored but how the dressing room reacted to the change in leadership. The thriller at The Oval - which helped India draw the series 2-2 - all but sealed the deal.Informal discussions on the road to the 2027 World Cup got underway, and they weren't random discussions. A blueprint was discussed with Gill and a pool of players was deliberated upon as the men who matter in Indian cricketing circles were convinced that Gill will have the armband for the multi-nation event two years later. The big question, however, remained how the BCCI will deal with Rohit Sharma who led India to Champions Trophy glory in his last assignment. Unlike Tests, there was the weight of runs behind him too but no guarantee of whether he would last the distance.The decision makers reasoned that two years was a long time and playing just one format wouldn't allow Rohit to have adequate game time. As far as Rohit was concerned, he continued doing his bit and made the right noises by clearing the necessary fitness tests and getting in shape before India's next assignment. The game time, however, which even Ajit Agarkar hinted at during the press-conference, was missing. The right-hander last played for India in the Champions Trophy and his last competitive outing came during the IPL for Mumbai Indians.Gill, meanwhile, scored a lot of runs in England, was appointed vice-captain for the Asia Cup T20 event and was given enough signals on the inevitable happening in the 50-over format too.Initially, the house remained divided as Rohit has been one of India's greatest white-ball captains and the call wasn't going to be that easy. But as the Australia tour got closer, the picture became much clearer. So much so that there was a section in Indian cricketing circles which wasn't in favour of sending both Rohit and Virat Kohli to Australia for ODIs. Surprisingly, the situation has come to a point where both Rohit and Virat are being looked at from the same microscope. Even after the vast difference in fitness levels, and an age gap of two years."If we keep dragging things, it will only get complicated. And with two players - one 38 (Rohit) and other 36 (Kohli) - you can't place the early bets. Yes, even the younger ones could lose form and fitness but it's the safer bet," they reasoned.When there was so much deliberation around even the Australia ODIs, the World Cup seemed like a distant destination. And it still is. Agarkar asserted, "I don't think we need to talk about it today," and there were strong hints of perform or perish applying to the modern-day greats going forward.They are expected to turn up for their domestic sides when there is no international cricket happening, and it will now be interesting to see whether both Rohit and Virat turn up for Mumbai and Delhi, respectively, in the Vijay Hazare Trophy."I think that we've made it clearer a couple of years back. Whenever the guys are available, they should be playing domestic cricket. That's the only way you'll keep yourself sharp and play cricket," said Agarkar.After Tests, Indian cricket's transition in ODIs is also underway with a change of leadership and it now remains to be seen whether the two giants Rohit and Virat last the distance or run out of gas before the 2027 World Cup. The men who matter seem to be convinced that at least Rohit won't.
Article Summary: Shubman Gill named India's new ODI captain, replaces Rohit Sharma ahead of Australia series. The decision makers got the conviction after seeing the side put up a solid show under the youngster in the five-Test series in England earlier in the year.

Article Title: 'What Mohsin Naqvi is doing is absolutely right': PCB chief gets backing after Asia Cup final trophy controversy

Article Title: Abhishek Sharma skips sister’s wedding, Tilak Varma stars; but India A suffer defeat to Australia A
Article Text:

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

NEW DELHI: India A suffered a nine-wicket defeat to Australia A in the rain-affected second List A match on Friday, despite a gritty 94 from Tilak Varma and the personal sacrifice of Abhishek Sharma , who skipped his sister’s wedding to be part of the squad.Chasing India A’s modest total of 246, the Aussies were set 160 in 25 overs via the Duckworth-Lewis method after a three-hour rain delay. Australia A had already reached 48 without loss before the break, and once play resumed, McKenzie Harvey (70 not out off 49 balls) and Cooper Connolly (50 off 31) completed the chase in 16.4 overs.The visitors punished India’s bowling attack, hitting 22 fours and six sixes, with pacer Arshdeep Singh conceding 44 runs in four overs.While Abhishek Sharma had been drafted as a potential long-term opening option, his contribution was minimal, falling to Jack Edwards’ first delivery. Tilak Varma, however, showcased his class, holding the innings together with 94 off 122 balls, featuring five fours and four sixes. He shared a 101-run fourth-wicket partnership with Riyan Parag (58 off 54) and added lower-order contributions of 34 and 28 runs with Ravi Bishnoi and Arshdeep Singh respectively, narrowly missing out on a well-deserved century. Shreyas Iyer failed to fire, scoring only eight as India A slumped to 17 for 3 early on. Edwards was the pick of the Australian bowlers, finishing with four wickets.The defeat levels the three-match series at 1-1, setting up a high-stakes decider on Sunday. Tilak’s fluent knock reinforced his claim for India’s 50-over setup, while Abhishek’s commitment off the field highlighted the personal sacrifices young cricketers make for national duty.

Article Title: Who is Mark Sanchez? Everything to know about the ex-NFL QB turned analyst after his recent attack
Article Text:
Who is Mark Sanchez (Getty Images)

Who is Mark Sanchez?



Mark Sanchez family and personal life



Former NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez, 38, is recovering after a violent altercation outside a bar in downtown Indianapolis left him hospitalized. Authorities confirmed that the former New York Jets star was stabbed during a fight early Saturday morning outside Loughmiller’s Pub & Eatery. Sanchez, who was in the city for Fox Sports’ broadcast of the Colts vs. Raiders game, is now in stable condition. He was later charged with misdemeanor counts of battery with injury, unlawful entry of a motor vehicle and public intoxication.Born on November 11, 1986, in Long Beach, California, Mark Sanchez grew up in a close-knit Mexican-American family. Raised primarily by his father, Nick Sr., a fire captain, Sanchez developed discipline and determination early in life. His journey from a promising young athlete at Santa Margarita Catholic High School to a college football star at USC was nothing short of remarkable.At USC, Sanchez led the Trojans to a 12-1 season in 2008, throwing 34 touchdowns and guiding them to a Rose Bowl victory over Penn State. His on-field leadership and calm under pressure made him a top prospect in the 2009 NFL Draft, where the New York Jets selected him fifth overall.Sanchez made an immediate impact in the NFL. As a rookie, he guided the Jets to the AFC Championship Game, matching a record for most postseason wins by a first-year quarterback. The following season, he repeated the feat, though the team fell short against the Steelers.Over ten seasons in the league, Sanchez played for the Jets, Eagles, Cowboys, Bears, and Redskins, throwing for more than 14,000 yards and 86 touchdowns. Though injuries and benchings challenged his career, his resilience stood out. He officially retired in 2019 and transitioned to broadcasting, quickly earning praise for his insight and charisma as a Fox Sports analyst.Off the field, Mark Sanchez has built a fulfilling personal life. He is married to actress Perry Mattfeld, known for her standout roles in Shameless and In the Dark. The couple met in 2017 through mutual friends, got engaged in May 2022, and married a year later in a stunning ceremony at a 16th-century colonial monastery in Oaxaca, Mexico.Together, they are proud parents of three children, including their son Daniel, who was eight years old in 2025 and took on the adorable role of ring bearer at their wedding. Despite the recent incident, the Sanchez family has requested privacy and has yet to release an official statement.As fans and colleagues rally behind him, Mark Sanchez’s resilience—both on and off the field—continues to define his journey.Also Read: Tyreek Hill injury update: Dolphins star faces uncertain future after devastating knee injury

Growing up, Brady says his dad provided structure and guidance without stifling his individuality, a balance he now tries to replicate with his own family.Rather than protecting Benjamin and Vivian from every mistake, Brady believes in letting life teach its own lessons. Article Title: Norm Nixon reveals what really pushed Julius Erving to snap at Larry Bird in a heated Celtics showdown
Article Text:
(Image Source - Getty Images)

Boston Celtics and Philadelphia 76ers rivalry burns bright through decades of legendary clashes

Larry Bird frustrates Philadelphia 76ers star Julius Erving with dominant play

Norm Nixon reveals Larry Bird’s trash Talk on Byron Scott’s fast break podcast

Showtime Secrets with Norm Nixon | The Byron Scott Trade & The Truth Behind HBO’s Winning Time

Some rivalries are remembered for their scores, while others are known for the drama. The matchups between Larry Bird’s Boston Celtics and Julius Erving’s Philadelphia 76ers were more than just basketball, they were mental showdowns. Larry Bird’s trash talk and fierce competitiveness could rattle even the calmest players. And when Julius Erving finally snapped, it wasn’t just a punch; it was a powerful message. This is the tale of how words and tension crafted one of the NBA ’s most iconic eras.The Boston Celtics and Philadelphia 76ers have been rivals since the 1960s, showcasing legends such as Bill Russell and Wilt Chamberlain.By the 1980s, Larry Bird was at the helm for the Boston Celtics, while the Philadelphia 76ers boasted Julius Erving, who is famously known as Dr. J.Julius Erving joined the Philadelphia 76ers in 1976 and was crucial in their win against the Boston Celtics in the 1977 Eastern Conference semifinals. The two teams frequently battled in the playoffs, with the high stakes adding to the excitement. Larry Bird, who made his debut in 1979, brought a new level of intensity with his competitive nature and trash-talking abilities.Julius Erving later shared that his animosity towards Larry Bird was rooted in their rivalry: "I don't care if it's your mother, you're not supposed to get along," he mentioned in a 2025 interview, showing the green jersey and Boston's banners as symbols of their opposition.On November 9, 1984, the undefeated Boston Celtics (4-0) took on the Philadelphia 76ers (5-0) at Boston Garden. Larry Bird was a force, scoring 42 points on 17-of-23 shooting in just 30 minutes, along with seven rebounds and three assists.The Boston Celtics won the game 130-119. Julius Erving contributed six points, three rebounds, and five assists before things got intense. Larry Bird's performance and his trash talk frustrated Julius Erving, who was 34 and nearing the end of his prime.Halfway through the third quarter, the game got more physical. Larry Bird was called for an offensive foul while backing down Julius Erving. Larry Bird stomped over to his bench, clearly upset with the referee.Julius Erving later recounted, "I thought he was gonna hit me... I reached out, and I just tried to hold him at bay, and I had him in this chest area, and I guess my hand kind slid upon his neck a little bit," in a 2024 interview. Larry Bird grabbed Julius Erving's neck in response, leading to punches.Julius Erving landed several punches, roughly five to eight, while Larry Bird responded. Moses Malone put Larry Bird in a headlock, igniting a massive fight. Both stars were tossed from the game.The NBA fined Julius Erving and Larry Bird $7,500 each, with the total fines amounting to $30,500 for the 18 people involved.On Byron Scott's Fast Break podcast in 2025, Norm Nixon revealed Larry Bird's trash talk as the trigger: "That’s why [Julius Erving], if you look at the tape, Doc called him at half court, grabbed and punched about eight times... You know he was in Doc’s ear."Norm Nixon shared a personal story from the 1985-86 season against the Los Angeles Clippers, where he played. Larry Bird approached: "Norm, I’m shooting all three tonight." Norm Nixon replied, "Maxwell is going to lock you up," referring to Cedric Maxwell. Larry Bird got fouled on his first three-pointer and stared down Norm Nixon.Norm Nixon called Larry Bird "one of the biggest trash talkers ever," noting how such taunts built frustration, leading to Julius Erving's snap.Reports indicate Larry Bird taunted Julius Erving by calling him "old" and saying "get off me" during the game.
